title: Holly Willoughby shoved fist in Mel B to win savage Celebrity Juice game
text:
Holly Willoughby shoved her fist in Mel B’s mouth to win Celebrity Juice game (Picture: ITV)

Celebrity Juice is returning to screens, with more wild antics from Keith Lemon and Holly Willoughby.

This time the pair have been joined by new team captain Mel B, after Paddy McGuinness was forced to quit over his Top Gear schedule.

And, Keith – real name Leigh Francis – revealed his co-stars are even more competitive than ever.

In fact, speaking exclusively to Metro.co.uk, he recalled the moment he saw the This Morning host shove her hand into the Spice Girl singer’s mouth, in a bid to win a game on a ‘testing day’.

Yes, seriously.

‘The games are different every series, almost every episode,’ the 46-year-old told us. ‘One of my favourites that we’ve done so far is called Box Mountain.

‘It sounds really simple. Basically it’s a mountain of boxes in the corner of the room. And on a shelf right at the top, we have a box of tissues. The winner is the first person to climb up and get the box of tissues. It’s quite hard because you just fall through the boxes.

‘Holly and Mel played it a couple weeks ago, and I swear at one point, I thought: “Has Holly got a hand inside Mel’s mouth, trying to get up there?”

Advertisement

Advertisement

‘They’re so competitive, both of them, so competitive, but that’s what makes great TV. And me just winding up Mel B all the time.’

Sounds like fun…

However, Keith insisted they actually ‘get on really well’, and Mel B has slotted into her team captain role perfectly.

‘We filmed four episodes so far. And Mel B has just been glorious,’ he continued. ‘Paddy couldn’t do it because he’s doing Top Gear. Mel’s just been fantastic.

Mel B slipped into her Celebrity Juice role like a total pro (Picture: Getty)

Maybe let’s just stay away from games where Holly ends up with her fist in Mel’s mouth…

Keith is currently fronting a campaign to promote cinema etiquette with Showcase cinema, sharing the top 10 things people find most annoying by watching films in public.

Think people slurping their drinks too loudly, chatting to anyone in sight and all kinds of PDA.

But there’s one thing that annoys the ITV2 star more than anything else – feet in cinemas.

To view this video please enable JavaScript, and consider upgrading to a web browser that supports HTML5 video

‘I don’t really complain about things. If someone is noisy in the cinema, I would just simply move,’ he added. ‘I’m always trying to be incognito, I won’t to go up to someone and say, “Can you please stop chomping your popcorn?”

Advertisement

Advertisement

‘Apparently 22% of people do confront other people about their etiquette at the cinema, but I don’t. I just put up with it.

‘I think the worst thing in the cinema for me, which is not on this list, is if someone puts their feet up on the back of your chair. How rude can you be? You might as well spit in my ears! Oh my gosh, when someone puts their feet up, what’s wrong with you?’

So basically, if you’re ever in the cinema with Keith, keep your shoes firmly on.

Celebrity Juice returns to screens on 10 October, at 10pm, on ITV2.

Got a showbiz story? If you've got a story, video or pictures get in touch with the Metro.co.uk Entertainment team by emailing us celebtips@metro.co.uk, calling 020 3615 2145 or by visiting our Submit Stuff page - we'd love to hear from you.

description: Celebrity Juice is returning tonight, with Keith Lemon, Holly Willoughby and new team captain Mel B - who replaced Paddy McGuinness
